Key Arguments: Skepticism about the government's ability to accurately determine misinformation and disinformation, citing past experiences with COVID-19 information.
Concerns about government overreach and potential bias in determining facts.
Belief that the legislation infringes on democratic rights and freedom of speech.
Distrust in international organizations like the World Economic Forum and the World Health Organization influencing government decisions.
Notable Quotes: I do not support Bill it is a breach of our democratic rights to freedom of free speech.

The past 3 years have shown the Australian Public just how much misinformation and disinformation the Australian Government and State Governments pushed with regards to Covid-19 and the 'Safe and Effective' Vaccine.
